result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 08/22/2022 - Okay to reschedule.**
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

Notice of Motion and Motion To Adjourn - Plea and Sentencing Date currently set for 07/21/22 @ 1:30 pm.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 7/18/2022 - Approved - matter to be rescheduled.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Shawn W McClusky in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  

Defense acknowledges receipt of the information, waives reading and enters Not Guilty Pleas.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:00 AM Defendant Shawn W McClusky appeared by Zoom with attorney Allison Marie Ritter who appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  Attorney Ritter is requesting an arraignment date before the Trial Court.  The Court will set this matter for arraignment before the Trial Court.  Arraignment scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

09:18 AM Defendant Shawn W McClusky in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to seek counsel.

THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM FOR THE NEXT COURT DATE.  Hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
